content: Cleaning and the organization of work

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p align span

html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The following factors need to be considered when choosing electrical appliances:

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Buy the best you can afford. Establish this by comparing prices in several outlets.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Buy from a reliable dealer, preferably one who has been in business several years.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Buy a brand that you are familiar with (or someone else has recommended to you).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Check for quality marks, i.e., BEAB (British Electrical Approvals Board).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Ensure the appliance is big enough to suit your individual and family needs.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Check that the appliance has a guarantee and even an after-sales service.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Compare several different appliances and consult 'Consumer Choice' magazine for an unbiased report on the appliance.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: The appliance should carry an 'Energy Efficiency' label. This should be on top or in front of the model on display in the shop. The scale goes from A to G with A being the most energy efficient (sometimes up to 55% better than the G rating).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: The appliance should be well-designed, with no sharp edges or difficult handles.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Small electrical appliances involve the use of heating elements or a small electric motor.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The element is heated by electricity which is attached to the base or side of the appliance.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: A thermostat based on a bi-metallic strip bends as it is heated and causes the circuit to be broken when it reaches a predetermined temperature. As the appliance cools, the bi-metallic strip straightens up and makes contact again thereby reconnecting the circuit and the appliance is automatically heat controlled.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span

html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: A motor, concealed in the appliance, is driven by electricity.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Air must be allowed to circulate freely in order to prevent overheating.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Attachments are fitted directly to the motor which drives them.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Do not handle with wet hands

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Do not allow the element to dry up

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Speed settings should be set for each specific task

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Ensure the appliance is set up correctly.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Do not immerse the appliance in water

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Attachments should be removed and washed separately

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Air vents should be cleaned out regularly

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Hard water causes a build up of limescale on kettle elements. This should be removed with vinegar or any commercial product designed for the purpose.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Wipe all appliances with a damp cloth after use and store in a cupboard with air circulating freely.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
content: The working principle of a refrigerator

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Heat is removed from food and the surrounding area, thereby creating an environment which retards the activity of microorganisms. Temperature is usually about 5ï¿½C.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: A refrigerant is used to remove the heat, i.e., a highly sensitive liquid which converts easily into a gas and back again into a liquid, e.g., freon12 or ammonia.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The refrigerant is carried in tubes at the back of the appliance and around the icebox.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The electric motor activates the compressor in the appliance which forces a gaseous refrigerant in the compressor into the condenser. In the condenser the refrigerant changes into a liquid, heat from the food in the refrigerator is absorbed by the liquid refrigerant and converts it back into a gas, ready for the cycle to begin again. In so doing, the food is cooled.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The refrigerator is thermostatically controlled to ensure an even temperature.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The outer case is made of enameled steel and the lining is made of plastic, with layers of insulation between them. The door is magnetically sealed.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The star marking rating is on the icebox and this refers to the temperature in the icebox and the length of time pre-frozen food can be stored in it.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span

html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
content: Fresh food can be frozen at this temperature

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Do not open the door too often or put hot food in the refrigerator

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Do not over pack or leave food uncovered

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Defrost regularly if no automatic defrost function exists

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Wash inside with warm water and a little bread soda

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Wash outside with hot soapy water, rinse and dry with dry cloth (a little furniture polish can be used on the outside).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: There are many different types of washing machine available, the most popular being the fully automatic top or front loader.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The wash programme can be controlled to suit different fabrics and degrees of soiling. A range of programmes exists, from normal wash, rinse and spin to soak, economy and half-load.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The machines are usually plumbed in, i.e., permanently connected to a water and electrical supply.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Low foam detergents lower the surface tension of water and allow the clothes to become wet. The hydrophobic part of the detergent attaches itself to the dirt and the hydrophylic part of the detergent attaches itself to the water.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: A motor causes the drum to rotate in half revolutions, causing the clothes to be tossed from side to side.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: A thermostat heats the water to a temperature suitable for the fabric and the degree of soiling, i.e., 40ï¿½C for normal washing and 90ï¿½C for heavy soiled cotton.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The soiled water is drained out of the machine through the perforated drum and empties into the waste pipe. The drum is filled again with cold water and the clothes are rinsed (usually two or three rinses). The machine is emptied and begins to revolve at high speed, exerting centrifugal force on the contents (the clothes are forced against the perforated drum and water is squeezed out of them).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The outer casing is made of enameled pressed steel. There is a glass door with a rubber ring to make it waterproof and a safety lock to prevent it being opened when the machine is in operation.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Inside is a perforated stainless steel drum. A motor rotates the drum and a thermostat heats the water. A pump controls the water input and output.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Typically, a washing machine can accommodate three or four kilograms of dry clothes and measures 60cm X 60cm X 80cm.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Sort out the items for washing into whites and coloured items, dirty and not so dirty items

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Use the correct detergent and amount as recommended by the manufacturer

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Select the appropriate programme according to the care label on the clothes

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Check the pockets of clothes for items

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Wash out the soap dispenser regularly

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Leave the door open when not in use

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Clean the outside of machine with hot soapy water. Rinse and dry with a dry cloth (a little furniture polish can be used to protect the casing).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span
content: Cleaning and the organization of work

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Cleaning within the house can be very tiring but good organisation can remove some of the problems associated with this chore.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Cleaning can be divided into three main areas:

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Jobs which need to be done

content: Jobs which need to be done

html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Place all the daily jobs in a logical order, e.g., do upstairs together and downstairs together

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Try to fit in some weekly jobs each day and occasional jobs can be fitted in when time and occasion allow

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Keep equipment where it is needed

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Collect everything that will be needed before starting

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Make full use of all labour-saving appliances

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: A good routine involving all members of the family will help to keep the home clean and safe.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span span span span span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span span span
content: Clothing is just one of the uses of textiles in the home. Others include bed linen, soft furnishings, towels and tea cloths.
